title: Strengthening Mathematics Practical Competencies to Promote Informal Learning Based on HRM

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental math concepts and work experience within an organization
context.additional_context: Utilizing smartphone-based learning materials in a limited-technology environment, emphasizing task applicability for managerial-level practitioners

learning_goals: The structural modeling can explain the linkage between HRM practices (recruitment, evaluation, compensation) and mathematical problem-solving.

Learners can design a 3-stage math practice process (problem definition → solution derivation → validation) in informal learning environments (e.g., online collaboration tools) by incorporating ≥3 peer feedback instances.
Learners will complete a mathematics-based decision-making simulation project applying organizational support theory.

resources: Structural Equation Modeling Simulation Tool (Web Version)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
